intro: Ailanthus altissima var. tanakae, commonly known as the Chinese tree of heaven, is a variant of the tree of heaven that exhibits distinct botanical characteristics. It is a deciduous tree with compound leaves consisting of 10–20 pairs of ovate, serrated leaflets. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive seed pods that split open to release winged seeds. It is native to China but has been introduced to various parts of the world, including the United States. This variant is notable for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a wide range of soil conditions.
